events.name: Get ready for DevOpsDays!
events.description: We're delighted to bring you the first ever DevOpsDays to Singapore in October this year! In this meetup we would like to show you how DevOpsDays work, how you can contribute and make the best out of it. *DevOpsDays what?!* DevOpsDays is a 2-day unconference for DevOps-minded people like you that will be held in Singapore on October 16th and 17th, 2015. Date: October 16-17 2015 Location: Raffles City Convention Centre, Singapore Website: http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/ *Why so special ah?* DevOpsDays are not the typical tech conference you might know. DevOpsDays follow a quite unique format and in this meetup we'd like to introduce you the core concepts of DevOpsDays. DevOpsDays work best when you step out of your comfort zone and contribute by asking questions, suggesting ideas for open spaces, talk etc. It's what *you* make out of it and we want to provide you the best environment for sharing, open discussions and having fun with like-minded people from all over the world. A lot of attendees report that their first DevOpsDays has been a career-changing experience (examples: https://www.google.com/search?q=devopsdays+review ). We aim high and believe that we can make this the best DevOps event in Asia. For that we would love to hear your feedback, questions and ideas upfront. *Sounds good… I have a question!* Just add a comment below to ask us all the questions. *Agenda* 18:45 Start – grab some great food from the buffet and enjoy a drink with others 19:15 *Talk: What is DevOpsDays & How is it special?* 19:35 Break 19:50 *Talk: Help you prepare a talk and OpenSpace for DevOpsDays* 20:05 Break 20:15 *Talk / Fishbowl: DevOpsDays FAQ* 21:00 End Food and drinks will be served.

events.name: Reactive applications night
events.description: Reactive applications is the new norm of developing systems, do come for our next session to listen and discuss about this topics. We hope to see you at the next Singapore Spring User Group on 29th July 2015 @Paypal (5 Temasek Blvd #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore[masked]): 7.00PM : Beer & Pizzas 7.30PM : Talks Speaker: Sergi Almar Title: Realtime Web with Spring: SSE and WebSockets Abstract: Real-time has changed the way we interact with the web. Real-time applications mimic what we have in the real world, information as it happens being pushed to us. In this presentation you will learn how to build a more interactive and engaging user experience with Server-Sent Events and WebSockets. We will review the Spring Websocket architecture, the STOMP support, how to secure a WebSocket application and the new Spring 4.2 features. Speaker: Xavier Lepretre Title : Introduction to RxJava, with code examples Description : Functional Reactive Programming, and in particular its Java implementation, is well suited to applications that rely a lot on asynchronous calls and thread hopping. Discover the major coding elements of RxJava that will get you started. Non-developers may have their eyes glaze over by the 7th slide, though. Bio: Xavier has been coding on and off from the days of BASIC and Pascal, has used RxJava with Android at TradeHero for the past 7 months and did not look back.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: PyLadies SG July 2015 Meetup - Introduction to Python
events.description: Martin Brochhaus, one of PyCon SG's organizers, will join us and give a little presentation about how to install Python on Windows, OSX or Ubuntu. He will also show how to use the free editor Atom.io as a Python IDE and guide us through the first steps of writing a Python program.
events.location: PayPal office at 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 7, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985
